1.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
1.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
An imitator, follower. From mimeomai; an imitator.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

2.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
2.str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
2.str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A sweet smell, fragrance. From a compound of eu and a derivative of ozo; good-scentedness, i.e. Fragrance.
Abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering. From thuo; sacrifice.
An offering, sacrifice. From prosphero; presentation; concretely, an oblation or sacrifice.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

3.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

3.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: It becomes, is fitting to, is right. Apparently a primary verb; to tower up, i.e. to be suitable or proper.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

3.word: there must not be even a hint
3.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: From onoma; to name, i.e. Assign an appellation; by extension, to utter, mention, profess.
Fornication, whoredom; met: idolatry. From porneuo; harlotry; figuratively, idolatry.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Uncleanness, impurity. From akathartos; impurity, physically or morally.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Covetousness, avarice, aggression, desire for advantage. From pleonektes; avarice, i.e. fraudulency, extortion.

4.str2: Obscenity, indecency, baseness. From aischros; shamefulness, i.e. Obscenity.
Foolish talking. From a compound of moros and lego; silly talk, i.e. Buffoonery.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Low jesting, ribaldry. From a compound of eu and a derivative of the base of trope; witticism, i.e. ribaldry.

4.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Plural
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: Is due, becoming, suitable, proper. From ana and heko; to attain to, i.e. be proper.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Thankfulness, gratitude; giving of thanks, thanksgiving. From eucharistos; gratitude; actively, grateful language.

5.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
This; he, she, it.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
5.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A fornicator, man who prostitutes himself. From pernemi; a prostitute, i.e. a debauchee.
Unclean, impure. Impure (lewd) or specially, (demonic).
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A covetous or avaricious person; one desirous of having more. From pleion and echo; holding more, i.e. Eager for gain.

5.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
5.str2: Who, which, what, that.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A server (worshipper) of an image (an idol). From eidolon and the base of latreuo; an image- worshipper.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From kleronomos; heirship, i.e. a patrimony or a possession.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
And, even, also, namely.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

6.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: To deceive, cheat, lead into error. Of uncertain derivation; to cheat, i.e. Delude.

6.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From oregomai; properly, desire, i.e., violent passion (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment.

6.str2: On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Willful unbelief, obstinacy, disobedience. From apeithes; disbelief.

7.str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

7.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

From agathos; goodness, i.e. Virtue or beneficence.
